body_content.explanation: something or someone that prevents something from happening or succeeding:
examples: I've installed an ad blocker so I don't get all those annoying adverts popping up when I'm browsing.
The school needs to identify staff who are blockers of progress.

body_content.explanation: something that prevents something from passing through it to reach a place:
examples: Titanium and zinc are effective blockers of ultraviolet radiation.

body_content.explanation: a substance or medicine that stops a particular process from happening in the body:
examples: Calcium channel blockers help control an irregular heart beat.
To test whether opiates were responsible for the effects, researchers gave subjects an opiate receptor blocker.

body_content.explanation: in American football, a player who stops players from the other team from reaching the player carrying the ball:
examples: His size and speed made him both an excellent blocker and a useful offensive player.
He was so good at sacking the quarterback that teams sometimes used as many as three blockers to keep him away.

body_content.explanation: in ice hockey (= a game played on ice), a large, thick piece of material worn on the hand and arm of a goaltender (= the player who stands in the team's goal to try to stop the other team from scoring):
examples: Right-handed goaltenders will wear the blocker on the right hand.
The puck bounced clear off the goalie's blocker.
